sentences.en: A hot plate will spoil the table's polish.
sentences.cn: 热盘子会弄坏桌面的光泽.

sentences.en: Don't bunch the flowers up so tightly, you'll spoil them.
sentences.cn: 别把花束得这么紧, 会弄坏的.

sentences.en: Don't spoil your appetite by eating sweets just before dinner.
sentences.cn: 不要在饭前吃糖来损害你的食欲.

sentences.en: Food will spoil if the temperature in your freezer rises above 8˚C.
sentences.cn: 如果冰柜的温度上升到 8 摄氏度以上，食物就会变质。

sentences.en: Frosts spoil the last of the flowers.
sentences.cn: 霜冻冻坏了最后一批花朵.

sentences.en: He is a man who will spoil rather than accomplish things.
sentences.cn: 他这个人成事不足,坏事有余.

sentences.en: He may spoil the whole show.
sentences.cn: 事情可能就败在他手里.

sentences.en: His mother and sisters spoil him rotten (= spoil him very much ) .
sentences.cn: 他母亲和姐姐把他给宠坏了。

sentences.en: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.cn: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.en: I had an uneasy feeling that he was going to spoil it.
sentences.cn: 我有种不安的感觉，觉得他会把事情搞糟。

sentences.en: It's important not to let mistakes spoil your life.
sentences.cn: 重要的是不要让错误毁了你的生活。

sentences.en: Most common health upsets that spoil a holiday are easily preventable.
sentences.cn: 导致假期泡汤的大多数常见的身体不适都是很容易预防的。

sentences.en: Overacting will only spoil the effect.
sentences.cn: 表演过火,效果反而不好.

sentences.en: She’s an only child, but they didn’t really spoil her.
sentences.cn: 她是独生女，不过他们也没有娇惯她。

sentences.en: Some kinds of food soon spoil.
sentences.cn: 有些食物易变质.

sentences.en: spoiling for a fight.
sentences.cn: 极想打一场架

sentences.en: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.cn: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.en: They could not afford to spoil those maps by careless colouring.
sentences.cn: 若是上色的时候不小心弄坏了那些地图，他们可承担不起。

sentences.en: They spoil their only grandson very much.
sentences.cn: 他们非常宠爱他们惟一的孙子.

sentences.en: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
sentences.cn: 厨子太多反而把汤做坏.

sentences.en: We all know that fats spoil by becoming rancid.
sentences.cn: 我们都知道油脂变质后会发臭。

sentences.en: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.cn: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.en: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.cn: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

words.tran_cn: 宠坏；毁坏（spoil的过去式及过去分词）

words: take a turn for the worse

phrases.tran_cn: (英)面对众多选择，难以决定取舍

trans.tran_cn: 战利品，成功所带来的好处，废石方
trans.tran_en: waste material such as earth and stones from a mine or hole in the ground

trans.tran_cn: 弄糟，溺爱，犒赏，善待，(食物)变坏，使(选票)无效
trans.tran_en: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc
